content:
The chunk is part of a graphical user interface (GUI) implementation in Python, specifically within a method responsible for drawing curves or paths on a canvas. The code draws lines and circles using the wxPython library's device context (`dc`), with different colors indicating selected versus unselected points. The `_OneTangent` flag determines whether to draw single or double tangents at control points. This functionality is used in an animation graph editor dialog, where users can interactively adjust curves by modifying their control points and tangents.

dc.SetPen(wx.Pen("cyan", 1))
                            dc.DrawLine(X1, Y1, X, Y)

                        if list[i][j][AG.SELECT] == 0:
                            dc.SetPen(wx.Pen("brown", 3))
                            dc.SetBrush(wx.Brush("brown"))
                            dc.DrawCircle(X, Y, 2)

                            dc.SetPen(wx.Pen("brown", 1))
                            dc.DrawLine(X1, Y1, X, Y)

                if self._OneTangent is False:
                    if list[i][AG.IN_TANGENT][AG.SELECT] == 1:
                        X = list[i][AG.IN_TANGENT][AG.LOCAL_VALUE][0]
                        Y = list[i][AG.IN_TANGENT][AG.LOCAL_VALUE][1]
                        dc.SetPen(wx.Pen("cyan", 3))
                        dc.SetBrush(wx.Brush("cyan"))
                        dc.DrawCircle(X, Y, 2)

                        dc.SetPen(wx.Pen("cyan", 1))
                        dc.DrawLine(X1, Y1, X, Y)
